topic_metadata.title: Can you have different values for the top margin AFTER the first page?

posts.name: Glenn
posts.cooked:
I would like to be able to set the top margin value differently on every page AFTER the first page.

Page 1 would have a top margin value of 1cm, every other pager after that would be set to 2.5cm.

TIA
posts.raw:

posts.name: Pascal Quach
posts.cooked:
Hello Glenn,

You can do that easily by adding another #set directive after your first page.

#set page(margin: (top: 1cm))

= Title page

#pagebreak()
#set page(margin: (top: 2.5cm))

= Page 2
Output

posts.raw:
Hello Glenn,

You can do that easily by adding another `#set` directive after your first page.

```typ
#set page(margin: (top: 1cm))

= Title page

#pagebreak()
#set page(margin: (top: 2.5cm))

= Page 2
```

posts.name: Laurenz Mädje
posts.cooked:
The way shown above works when you’re fine with an explicit page break. If that’s a problem, you can simply add negative vertical spacing at the start of your document like this: v(-1.5cm).

This only works for the first page of the document though. For other pages, it is not possible at the moment. See this question: How to get differently-sized header or footer depending on page number?

posts.cooked:
I don’t know why this wasn’t mentioned, but you don’t need an explicit pagebreak() right before set page(), generally speaking. I think there are cases where set page() won’t automatically create a page break. One example (and maybe the only one?) is when you write set page() (but then why would you write it at all, right?).

That means this would work the same way as the initial solution:

#set page(margin: (top: 1cm))
= Title page
#set page(margin: (top: 2.5cm))
= Page 2

That means this would work the same way as the initial solution:
